alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Choctaw County through 1015 PM CDT... At 945 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southwest of Kinterbish, or 12 miles south of Cuba, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Choctaw County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
